meanings.definition: Feeling or showing anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: She was iratest when her brother broke her favorite toy.
meanings.sent2: The iratest customer demanded to speak to the manager.
meanings.sent3: The iratest cat knocked over the vase in protest.
meanings.sent4: His iratest glare could make anyone feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The iratest storm clouds gathered ominously in the sky.

meanings.definition: To make someone angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: Please don't iratest your sister by teasing her.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site iratested the residents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy iratested the older dog by stealing its bone.
meanings.sent4: His careless remarks iratested his classmates during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The delayed flight iratested the passengers waiting at the gate.
